description:
Error: "libvirtError: internal error Invalid harddisk device name: /dev/sdf"

When:   Instance with attached volume as /dev/sdf is started from stopped state

Reproduction scenario:

1. "euca-run-instance ami ..... -t ... -z ...."
       create i-0123456789

2. "euca-attach-volume vol.... -i i-0123456789 -d /dev/sdf"
       volume is attached

3. "virsh dumpxml  i-0123456789"
    ...
    <disk type='block' device='disk'>
      <driver name='qemu' type='raw' cache='none'/>
      <source dev='/dev/disk/by-path/ip-.....3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:vol-000000xy-lun-1'/>

      <target dev='sdf' bus='virtio'/>  <!- THIS IS IMPORTANT -->

      <alias name='virtio-disk5'/>
      <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x00' slot='0x08' function='0x0'/>
    </disk>
    ....

3. euca-stop-instance i-0123456789
     still OK
     
4. euca-start-instance i-0123456789
     ERROR !!!!

     the "/var/lib/nova/instances/i-0123456789/libvirt.xml" file include

          <disk type='block'>
                   <driver name='qemu' type='raw' cache='none'/>
                     <source dev='/dev/disk/by-path/ip-....:3260-iscsi-iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:vol-000000xy-lun-1'/>

                     <target dev='/dev/sdf' bus='virtio'/>  <!-- WRONG !!! -->
          </disk>
title: Starting Instance from 'stopped' state with attached volume cause libvirt error
